name: Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Workspace
description: Analysis tools for the MBTI personality framework
author: OCEAN Personality Dynamics

dimensions.name: Extraversion (E) - Introversion (I)
dimensions.description: Where you focus your attention and get your energy

poles.name: Extraversion
poles.description: Focus on the outer world of people and activities; energized by interaction

poles.name: Introversion
poles.description: Focus on the inner world of ideas and impressions; energized by reflection

dimensions.name: Sensing (S) - Intuition (N)
dimensions.description: How you take in information and what you pay attention to

poles.name: Sensing
poles.description: Focus on concrete, real information you can perceive directly

poles.name: Intuition
poles.description: Focus on patterns, possibilities, and meaning

dimensions.name: Thinking (T) - Feeling (F)
dimensions.description: How you make decisions and come to conclusions

poles.name: Thinking
poles.description: Base decisions on objective logic and consistent principles

poles.name: Feeling
poles.description: Base decisions on personal values and people-centered concerns

dimensions.name: Judging (J) - Perceiving (P)
dimensions.description: How you approach the outside world and structure your life

types.name: The Inspector
types.description: Practical, fact-minded, reliable, and responsible. Decide logically what should be done and work toward it steadily, regardless of distractions.

types.name: The Protector
types.description: Quiet, friendly, responsible, and conscientious. Committed to meeting obligations and serving others.

types.name: The Counselor
types.description: Seek meaning and connection in ideas, relationships, and material possessions. Want to understand what motivates people.

types.name: The Architect
types.description: Have original minds and great drive for implementing their ideas and achieving their goals.

types.name: The Craftsman
types.description: Tolerant and flexible, quiet observers until a problem appears, then act quickly to find workable solutions.

types.name: The Composer
types.description: Quiet, friendly, sensitive, and kind. Enjoy the present moment, what's going on around them.

types.name: The Healer
types.description: Idealistic, loyal to their values and to people who are important to them. Want an external life that is congruent with their values.

types.name: The Architect
types.description: Seek to develop logical explanations for everything that interests them. Theoretical and abstract, interested more in ideas than in social interaction.

types.name: The Dynamo
types.description: Flexible and tolerant, they take a pragmatic approach focused on immediate results. Theories and conceptual explanations bore them.

types.name: The Performer
types.description: Outgoing, friendly, and accepting. Exuberant lovers of life, people, and material comforts.

types.name: The Champion
types.description: Warmly enthusiastic and imaginative. See life as full of possibilities.

types.name: The Visionary
types.description: Quick, ingenious, stimulating, alert, and outspoken. Resourceful in solving new and challenging problems.

types.name: The Supervisor
types.description: Practical, realistic, matter-of-fact. Decisive, quickly move to implement decisions.

types.name: The Provider
types.description: Warmhearted, conscientious, and cooperative. Want harmony in their environment.

types.name: The Teacher
types.description: Warm, empathetic, responsive, and responsible. Highly attuned to the emotions, needs, and motivations of others.

types.name: The Commander
types.description: Frank, decisive, assume leadership readily. Quickly see illogical and inefficient procedures and policies.

tools.name: Type Identifier
tools.description: Identify your MBTI type through a series of questions

tools.name: Cognitive Functions Analysis
tools.description: Analyze the eight cognitive functions and their stack order

tools.name: Career Guidance
tools.description: Find career paths that match your personality type

tools.name: Relationship Dynamics
tools.description: Understand how different types interact in relationships

key_studies.title: Gifts Differing: Understanding Personality Type
key_studies.authors: Myers, I. B., & Myers, P. B.
key_studies.summary: The foundational text on MBTI theory and applications.

key_studies.title: MBTI Manual: A Guide to the Development and Use of the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator
key_studies.authors: Myers, I. B., McCaulley, M. H., Quenk, N. L., & Hammer, A. L.
key_studies.summary: Comprehensive guide to the MBTI assessment and its applications.

criticisms.title: Measuring the MBTI... And Coming Up Short
criticisms.summary: Critical analysis of the reliability and validity of the MBTI.

criticisms.title: The Relationship Between Myers-Briggs Type Indicator and Emotional Intelligence
criticisms.summary: Study examining the relationship between MBTI types and emotional intelligence.
